value.title: Power BI for report consumers and end users (2021)
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers, or end users. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  📢 Become a member:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/cZsQj1WFkGE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI for the NON-TECHnical person
value.excerpt: Is Power BI intimidating? Coming from Microsoft Excel? You consider yourself non-technical? Don't want to have to write or know anything about DAX? Patrick looks at how you can create a report quickly with just your Excel data and not have to write any code!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/S7Fh2l-4jlc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MJVSu47iMmo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI query reduction when using DirectQuery
value.excerpt: Using DirectQuery in Power BI? Things slowing down and you want to make interactions snappier? Patrick looks how you can change a few settings to take the experience within Power BI to the next level!  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI reports for consumers (end users)
value.excerpt: Adam walks through how to navigate and use Power BI reports for consumers, or end users. This is geared towards someone not really familiar with the Power BI interface or how to use Power BI reports to their fullest.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Preventing Data Silos with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick and Kalyn look at data silos and how to prevent it using Power BI. Different options exist, such as Analysis Services, Azure Analysis Services or models hosted in the Power BI service.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: RLS with TWO Fact tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you struggled with using Row-Level Security (RLS) on a dimension connected to two fact tables? Patrick looks at some options you can use to accomplish this in Power BI.  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: The BANANAS approach to use Power BI Bookmarks to swap tooltips

value.title: To Pivot or Unpivot? That is the question!
value.excerpt: Sometimes your data isn't shaped the right way. Have you tried the Pivot or Unpivot methods in Power Query? They can help get your data looking the right way for your Power BI reports!  Pivot columns https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-query/pivot-columns  Unpivot columns https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-query/unpivot-column

value.title: Tracing with Log Analytics and Power BI
value.excerpt: With Log Analytics integration in Power BI, you can now capture Analysis Services trace events easily and over a longer period of time. Combined with the Power BI template report, you can gain a lot of insights into usage of your datasets. With more to come down the road!  Announcing long-term usage

value.title: Using Single Sign-on with the Power BI Gateway
value.excerpt: Let's dig into the Power BI gateway and Single Sign-On (SSO) using Kerberos!  This can be used for both DirectQuery and refreshing a Power BI dataset. value.title: What are Power BI data connectors and why should you care?
